About Me

"So", I asked myself, "maybe I can look at these different paths I've taken and see where they all connect." This point of connection was coding!

Read More

David Damian's Story

David is a motivated self-taught developer with a versatile background looking for further development of his skills in a professional environment. With extensive creativity, the ability to see situations from different perspectives and a good sense of logic, programming was the ideal route to follow. After following different creative ambitions for a period, a greater challenge was sought, a place where his creativity and reasoning could come together. After two and a half years of training himself in Java and, among other things, in Javascript, HTML, C#, JQuery and Nodejs, various projects were done, such as:

- Multiplayer space game, with self-designed server engine, game engine, game physics and animations,
- Android games, a mix of breakout, bubble shooter and pong,
- various bots, including a Twitter / Youtube bot: automatic posting on Twitter
of selected YouTube videos,
- various apps for the Android, including a weather app.
- and a website (the one you're on right now!) with various kinds of pages, posing as their own website.

The Story Continues

The focus of the study was primarily on learning the Java programming language, while emphasizing the correct modulation of the code. From an idea, study work was sought out and then various projects were made, in order to ultimately form a broad knowledge of Java. The knowledge about Java could then be used to gain knowledge of other subjects / languages / disciplines.

My goal was to teach myself to code. I used my philosophy background and affinity for logic to help me find the way. After just a couple of years I am able to design and develop solutions that represent everything my skills need to compete in the modern marketplace.
